title: Push Through LIMITATIONS At Any AGE and Get Sh*t Done | Tom Bilyeu
description:
Build IRONCLAD discipline in this FREE workshop: https://bit.ly/3RFH0Vh

On Today's Episode:

If you’re being haunted by an internal desire pulling you to want more. If you’re totally frustrated and feeling like it's too late or too hard to redefine your life and reinvent yourself, whether because of your age or past circumstances, this is for you. So many people dream, want and covet an extraordinary life, but the same people run a self defeating, self sabotaging and suffocating narrative that prevents them from taking action or even believing they can. Is this where you are right now? Can you relate and more importantly are you fed up with the shame, the negativity and self doubt? Tom is breaking down exactly how you can start getting the most out of your life and begin to make extraordinary changes no matter what your age or circumstances. Part of the solution is exploring to find out what you would enjoy doing even if it failed and took you nowhere. The other part of the solution is refining your skills, getting off your ass and valuing yourself for the pursuit of the journey and how you feel about yourself when you are by yourself.

SHOW NOTES:

0:00 | Introduction
0:29 | Break Old Patterns
8:58 | Building An Escape Plan
12:35 | Reinvent Yourself
17:05 | Brain in a Vat Experiment
21:09 | Pour Energy into the System
25:26 | Excited to See Others Win

QUOTES:

“There's a difference between ambition, being a dreamer. And having drive and seeing those dreams to fruition.” [3:29]

“Don't say you're going to do one thing, and then actually do another. There's no integrity in that.” [6:03]

“What is it that you can fall in love with enough that makes all the fighting through the negative voice and all of that worth it? There is a process that you can go through that instead of being about change is about falling in love.” [13:39]

“If you build your self esteem around winning, or being better than them, that's a recipe for a miserable life.” [27:21]

“The whole punchline of life is to feel good about yourself when you're by yourself to live a life that is full of joy, to be fulfilled.” [28:15]
